Ho provato l'originale Half Life inizialmente e poi la versione "Source" rimasterizzata appena ho scoperto la sua esistenza. Nella versione "Source" abilitando le texture ad alta definizione nelle impostazioni, permette di migliorare la qualitÃ  dei modelli del gioco, ma le texture dei livelli non cambiano molto dalla versione originale; perÃ² la qualitÃ  dell'acqua e dei riflessi sono molto belli, che al contrario nella versione originale non sono granchÃ©. 
Incredibile come un gioco del 1998 (Source 2004)  possa sbalordire un videogiocatore oltre 20 anni dopo la sua uscita, e diverte molto piÃ¹ dei giochi odierni !
Certamente la versione del 1998 non ha una grafica mozzafiato, un audio sensazionale e modelli ultra dettagliati; perÃ² devo dire che per quell'anno i modelli sono fatti anche abbastanza bene, ma la cosa che mi ha stupito, Ã¨ l'esistenza della gravitÃ  negli oggetti inseriti nel gioco, che apparentemente sembrano semplicemente modelli statici.
Half Life include cinematiche in-game, effetti speciali abbastanza dettagliati e una storia molto coinvolgente.
Il gameplay offre meccaniche da fps con una vasta esplorazione della mappa di gioco; spronando il giocatore a trovare soluzioni per proseguire con la storia, senza che siano troppo guidati. Quello che voglio dire Ã¨ del tipo: "Ma se corro fin lÃ   e faccio questa cosa cosa qui, forse riesco a uccidere quel nemico. proviamo !"; oppure "Chi lo sa se posso spostare quella scatola per salire su quel piano che non posso raggiungere", ecc...
Sono molto soddisfatto di aver giocato questo titolo, e dalla mia esperienza ho capito il perchÃ¨ della sua fama.
Il gioco non si puÃ² definire di certo facile, anzi: Io l'ho giocato a difficoltÃ  normale e, nonostante questo, certe situazioni si sono rivelate ostiche da superare. Per questo l'unico punto negativo ( ma per certi versi anche positivo ) Ã¨ che certe situazioni si sono rivelate frustanti, dalle continue morti che subivo; perÃ² questo mi spronava di piÃ¹ per continuare a provare !

Conclusione basata sulla versione Source ( con valutazione di un gioco del 1998  con grafica del 2004 ):
Audio: 7
Soundtrack: 8
Grafica/dettaglio: 8.5
Gameplay: 9
Storia: 8.5

GOOD GAME
A timeless classic, besides graphics and all

A remake of the timeless classic Half Life in the source engine. You should rather play the original, non-source version. Why? Shiny surfaces are overdone in this version, everything metal or ceramic looks overly polished. Some bugs are introduced (scientists hovering over chairs instead of sitting), some short dialogue and little character animations are missing. Things like vending machines don't work proberly to refill your health. 

The nice water, shiny metal and ceramic surfaces and shadows are the major graphical updates but also stand out because they don't fit the art style of the game. 

It's okay-ish, but the original is the better experience IMHO.

Edit: It's all fixed with the Mod *Half Life: Source Fixed* - absolute recommendation with this mod!

Una vez acabado el juego he de decir que me ha encantado,nunca lo juegue en su dia,mas que nada me dedicaba a jugar el mod de counter strike 1.6 en cyber y en casa,la jugabilidad es bastante buena para ser de la epoca,una dificultad muy grande en el modo facil,no quiero pensar como sera en niveles mas complejos, y aunque el juego es muy "pasillero" algo acorde con la epoca esta bien llevado,recomiendo leer alguna guia para no quedar atascado en determinadas zonas, tambien  que hay varios fallos tecnicos que entorpecen la jugabilidad pero nada que no se pueda dejar pasar pues son cosas puntuales, decir tambien que el monstruo final las he pasado canutas mas de 3 horas hasta conseguir derrotarlo,leyendo y viendo videos hasta que lo consegui,en definitiva ahora entiendo el exito que tuvo en su dia y es que un clasico nunca muere.

Cons: bad ladders, Residue Processing is an awful chapter, a few unfair booby-traps and weird level design at times, buggy and possibly the worst end boss I have ever faced.
Pros: phenomenal gunplay, brilliant enemy design, great weapons, a solid challenge, interesting setpieces and a great aesthetic to tie it all together.
Overall it still holds up in most places, worth a try even if there are parts best skipped.

Also those sharks are genuinely terrifying.

Valve shat the bed with this one and never owned up to it or fixed the issues they've introduced into this game due to engine updates. Either bosses can't be beaten or missing or broken animations and models.  So much potential for a remaster was wasted on this to begin with. They could have updated textures, increase the fidelity of models, allow items to be picked up, recompile the maps with increased lightmap fidelity, etc... to make this better than what it is now (I'm just saying the things they could have done at release to make this better, I'm not advocating them to do the aforementioned changes (except bug fixes) now). 

It feels like Valve deliberately avoids this game whenever they go about their rounds to issue bug fixes for their older titles (which is rare on its own). Just look how many open issues are for this game on their Github issue tracker and compare it to their other games: https://github.com/ValveSoftware/Source-1-Games/issues?utf8=%E2%9C%93&q=is%3Aopen+is%3Aissue+label%3A%22Half-Life%3A+Source%22+
103 as of writing. Don't buy this game unless you just want the assets or you just want to own the whole Half-Life franchise. 

This game has its highs, the gibs are fun(ny at times) (albeit annoying that they sound like plastic rather than flesh), the ragdolls are entertaining, easier for speedrun practice or Machinimas since there is a chapter selection menu (albeit less relevant since maps can be loaded directly via console), but other than that it falls flat. The reason why I have over 47 hours on this is due to fucking around or trying to do playthroughs with different play styles.

TL:DR
Buy the original Half-Life. This version sucks and should be free if Valve isn't going to support it.

What do you expect, this is one of the best pc games ever made, if you haven't played it just play it. Although this version is still alright, it is still vastly inferior to the original (due to certain bugs), so avoid this one and play the original or play the fan remake, Black Mesa.

Probably one of the greatest games ever made. It was way ahead of its time and 20 years later it continues to excite and haunt you. The story, the music, and the art direction put this game in a league of its own. Highly recommended despite its dated look and feel.

One of the classic Fps games to come out of the 90's. Each section feels fun and unique, and never breaking out of your pov really adds to the immersion. Source port feels a bit wonky though. What i mean is that things feel like your running on ice. Isn't a deal breaker but hurts the experience a bit. Story this great and is worth experiencing. If you are willing to get over the quirks. You'll find a good game. 7/10

BEST GAME EVER

A really poor excuse of a remaster. Granted, the lighting and water effects are neat; but at the end of the day, it's just a more broken version of the original game that fully breaks half way through. It can be fixed, so it's not unplayable...

[b]but then, why not just play the original one (or the remake) instead?[/b]
It's an amazing game, you guys should try it out, you'll love it. I really like the story, even though the graphics are meh for its day but still, It is worthy enough to be in my favorite games list.

[quote][url=https://store.steampowered.com/curator/33401179/]Follow my curator page for more recommendations![/url][/quote]
Don't let Half-Life: Source be your first journey into Half-Life. This is not the version you want. Go play the [url=https://store.steampowered.com/app/70/HalfLife/]original Half-Life.[/url]

All Source does is add ragdolls and prettier water. Well, it also adds new lighting and textures in some areas (read: they look [i]very[/i] bad), major crashing issues, and an assortment of bugs. Valve hasn't updated it since 2013. It will stay broken forever.

But that's fine, because the original Half-Life is better! It plays perfectly fine with barely any bugs. It also has [i]way[/i] more mods available, if that's your thing.

[i]Side note: I had to leave the game idling for a bit so that I could write a review. I bought Half-Life: Source back in 2007, but Steam didn't start tracking hours until sometime in 2009, hence why above my review it says I barely have any playtime.[/i]
